keywords.indexterm: Configure the ApplicationEditor preferencesauthor track changes

body.p: lets you enter review comments and track changes in your documents. The Review preferences control how the review features work. To configure the Review options, and go to Editor Edit modes Author Review .

ul.li: Author - Specifies the name to be attached to all comments and to changes made while Track Changes is active.

Initial State - Track Changes is turned on and off separately for each document you open. You may have some opened documents for which track changes is turned on and others for which it is turned off. This setting specifies whether Track Changes is turned on when you open a document. The options are:
Stored in document - The current state of track changed is stored in the document itself, meaning that track changes on or off depending on the state the last time the document was saved. This is the recommended setting when multiple writers work on the same set of documents as it will make it obvious to other writers that changes have been made in the document.
Always On - The Track Changes feature is always on when you open a document. You can turn it off for an open document, but it will be turned on for the next document you open.
Always Off - The Track Changes feature is always off when you open a document. You can turn it on for an open document, but it will be turned off for the next document you open.

Display changed lines marker - A changed line maker is a vertical line on the left side of the editor window indicating where changes have been made in the document. It is displayed only for documents for which track changes is turned on. To hide the changed lines marker, deselect this option.

Inserted content color - Sets the color that is used for marking inserted content. This includes the font foreground and background, and the underline that decorates all inserted text. The options are:
Auto - A different color is assigned to each writer's changes. This is the default option.
Custom - Uses the specified color for all changes, regardless of the writer's name.
Use same color for text foreground - The text foreground is displayed in the same color as surrounding text, not the inserted content color.
Use same color for background - The text background is displayed in the same color as surrounding text, not the inserted content color.
Deleted content color - Sets the color that is used for marking deleted content. The options are the same as for the Inserted content color.

Comments color (applies for all authors) - Sets the background color of the text that is commented on. The options are:
Auto - A different color is assigned to each writer's changes. This is the default option.
Custom - Uses the specified color for all changes, regardless of the writer's name. Use the slider to control the transparency level.
